net.imglib2.cache.util

Class LoaderRemoverCacheAsLoaderCacheAdapter<K,V,D>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.imglib2.cache.util.LoaderRemoverCacheAsLoaderCacheAdapter<K,V,D>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - key type
    V - value type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractCache<K,V>, Invalidate<K>, LoaderCache<K,V>

    public class LoaderRemoverCacheAsLoaderCacheAdapter<K,V,D>
extends Object
implements LoaderCache<K,V>
    Wraps a LoaderRemoverCache<K,V> as a LoaderCache<K,V>. This is done by supplying a default CacheRemover (specified in the constructor) to LoaderRemoverCache.get(Object, CacheLoader, CacheRemover).
    Author:
    Tobias Pietzsch

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(K key)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractCache
        Removes and discards the entry with the specified key.

        Note that this will not call CacheRemover.onRemoval(Object, Object) for the discarded entry.

        If this cache has a CacheRemover, calls CacheRemover.invalidate(Object) for the discarded entry, (which should in turn remove it from any backing cache). Note that this applies only when the whole cache has a CacheRemover, instead of each individual entry as in LoaderRemoverCache.

        There must be no concurrent get() operations for key. This may result in cache corruption and/or a deadlock.

        Specified by:
        invalidate in interface AbstractCache<K,V>
        Specified by:
        invalidate in interface Invalidate<K>
        Parameters:
        key - key of the entry to remove

      • invalidateIf

        public void invalidateIf(long parallelismThreshold,
                         Predicate<K> condition)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractCache
        Removes and discards all entries with keys matching condition.

        Note that this will not call CacheRemover.onRemoval(Object, Object) for the discarded entries.

        If this cache has a CacheRemover, calls Invalidate.invalidateIf(Predicate) for the discarded entries, (which should in turn remove them from any backing cache). Note that this applies only when the whole cache has a CacheRemover, instead of each individual entry as in LoaderRemoverCache.

        There must be no concurrent get() operations for keys matching condition. This may result in cache corruption and/or a deadlock.

        Specified by:
        invalidateIf in interface AbstractCache<K,V>
        Specified by:
        invalidateIf in interface Invalidate<K>
        Parameters:
        parallelismThreshold - the (estimated) number of entries in the cache needed for this operation to be executed in parallel
        condition - condition on keys of entries to remove

      • invalidateAll

        public void invalidateAll(long parallelismThreshold)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractCache
        Removes and discards all entries.

        Note that this will not call CacheRemover.onRemoval(Object, Object) for the discarded entries.

        If this cache has a CacheRemover, calls CacheRemover.invalidateAll(long) (which should in turn invalidate any backing cache). Note that this applies only when the whole cache has a CacheRemover, instead of each individual entry as in LoaderRemoverCache.

        There must be no concurrent get() operations. This may result in cache corruption and/or a deadlock.

        Specified by:
        invalidateAll in interface AbstractCache<K,V>
        Specified by:
        invalidateAll in interface Invalidate<K>
        Parameters:
        parallelismThreshold - the (estimated) number of entries in the cache needed for this operation to be executed in parallel
